headline.main: FEWER HIGH SCHOOL SENIORS REPORTED USING ILLICIT DRUGS

docs.lead_paragraph: High school seniors continued to reduce their use of illicit drugs, and the number smoking marijuana daily has dropped to its lowest level since the Government began keeping figures in 1975, a study said Monday. The annual survey found that 63 percent of the members of the class of 1983 who participated in the survey had tried an illicit drug, down from 66 percent in each of the three previous years. About two out of five seniors said they had tried an illicit drug other than marijuana, according to the survey prepared for the National Institute on Drug Abuse by the University of Michigan's Institute for Social Research. Some 47 percent of seniors reported using an illicit drug sometime in the preceding year, down 6 percent from the peak of 53 percent in 1979.
